revised_title: Inverted Action of Alburnous Vessels in Trees
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
tldr: The author, Thomas Andrew Knight, conducted experiments on tree growth and sap circulation. He discovered that alburnous vessels in trees can have an inverted action to preserve the plant's existence. Knight also found that removing a portion of bark from potato plants led to the formation of tubers at the base of the leaves of the depending branches. This research provides insight into plant physiology and tree growth.
